reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at this hotel in April together with another English couple who have visited New Orleans several times before. We all agreed the location was perfect - near all the action but not so noisy as to affect sleep. The hotel has real personality with attractive courtyards to sit in and plan your activities or recover with a drink from the bar. The breakfast was more than adequate to fire up your day but in keeping with the rest of the city chicory is added to the coffee, which is an acquired taste! The rooms were spacious and clean. Reception were really helpful and if you are lucky enough to get Sherlane make good use of her. She sorted out tours for us, advised about restaurants, provided us with lots of discount vouchers and was altogether a delightful person. Secure parking at a very reasonable price was another bonus. D
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: This hotel is the perfect French Quarter location. Our room had a balcony facing the French Market. When we tired of walking we sat and had a beer there and listened to a jazz band mearby.
reviews.title: Perfect French Quarter ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel consists of 5 buildings around a protected parking area, a pool and courtyards. The staff is friendly and anxious to serve.
reviews.title: good location, price steep though for what you get

reviews.text: Our room reminded me of Europe with antique decor with an updated, modern bathroom. The price was reasonable for the quarter. Near Cafe du Monde and Jackson Square.
reviews.title: Ideal location for a visit to New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in mid April. The location was great- not too noisy but very convenient. We had a junior suite- which just means a bit of a sitting area/larger room. The bathroom was small and old but adequate. There was a pretty good continental breakfast but no coffee /tea set out through the day and no hot water maker in the room, not much of a lobby- just a check in desk. For this, two people, we spent 249 for the weeknights and 299 for the Friday night we were there. The pool area is quite nice though still a bet early in the season to use it. Our room faced the street and though there was some street noise, it didnt keep me up. I suspect that it would be worse during Jazz fest, Mardi Gras. I would not want a room facing the patio /pool area due to noise. It was a bit odd that there was a balcony but the windows/doors did not open to allow access to this. when the weather got warmer, we realized that our AC wasnt working and they got it fixed by the end of the day.
reviews.title: Four nights in the French Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in the French Quarter for the price. Right next door to one of the best fine dining resturants in NOLA....Stella's. Lots more good eats places right around the corner on Decatur. Conventient to everything, including Frenchman's late night. My husband complained because there was no balcony, but the cost would have gone up tremendously. So, no balcony, but small courtyard. Our room was well decorated in antiques and nostalgic furnishings to include wrought iron, brass, crown molding, and chair rails. Very charming. Our queen bed and beddings were very comfy/casual. NIce carpet The bathroom was modern chic and very clean. The elevators in my building were slow and small. The staff was helpful with info and considerate. Not pet friendly.
reviews.title: Quaint and Charming

reviews.text: The hotel is close to Jackson Square, but in a quiet part of the Quarter. The hotel itself is charming with fountains and a pool. We had a view of the Mississippi and it was lovely.There is a is a small bar on the property and they serve complimentary continental breakfasts in AM. The staff were very friendly and polite. We stayed in building 5 which was a hospital years ago. The bathroom was remodeled and lovely. The room was very comfortable for two people. I would absolutely stay here again. It was close to everything and quiet!
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room for 110 + taxes, which is a fabulous price for the location. The hotel is close to Jackson Square, but in a quiet part of the Quarter. The courtyard and pool are lovely and there is a bar on property where they serve complimentary continental breakfasts in AM. The staff were very friendly and polite. Our room was on the pool and it was very quiet. The bedroom was ok; adequate but nothing fancy. The bathroom, however, was very much in need of remodeling. The tub was plastic and I could hear water "squishing" under the tub when I stepped in. If they will modernize the bath, we will stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location and price, but needs remodeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was horribly over priced. We have traveled alot. We have stayed in boutique hotels to lavish chains all over the world but this stay was the worst. We booked a suite paying $400 a night. We had horrible service, bugs in the 1960 bathroom, dark and musty room with little or no light. We had no help from the front desk because we could not contact the front desk no phone. Almost missed our cab going to airport because of it. We had to drag our bags down two flights of stairs no elevator. Everything needed updating except beautiful drapes and two new televisions. The court yards in the other buildings were charming but our courtyard not so much. Would not stay here ever again.
reviews.title: Horrible

reviews.text: My friend and I visited NOLA for the first time in late March for 3 nights and chose this hotel because of the location (right in FQ, walking distance to everything), reasonable price and great reviews. You seriously can not beat the location. The hotel itself is charming with fountains, courtyards and two pools, and the staff was really friendly and let us check our bags the first and last day of our trip. There's also a free continental breakfast each morning, which was convenient. Also, I've seen mixed reviews on here - but we never experienced hearing street noise late at night, this may be due to the fact that we slept in the furthest building of the hotel, though.
reviews.title: Amazing location in the Quarter (though a little spooky!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a lot of things I liked about this hotel, but some basic things that keep it from getting a good/excellent rating from me.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, pretty good hotel

reviews.text: First the good:
reviews.title: Perfect location, but Historic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is wonderful - in the Lower Quarter, so in the more residential, quiet side, and only a few blocks from Jackson Square, Frenchman St, etc. We loved being so close to everything and having the option to pop back into the hotel any time we wanted.
reviews.title: Perhaps not the very best, but nonetheless a really good choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very charming, has a great courtyard, and nice pools. I loved swimming in the afternoon and relaxing in the courtyard after wandering around all day. The historic building is neat, really has the old New Orleans feel to it.
reviews.title: Small, cute hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are comfortably furnished, and our bed was one of the best hotel beds I've slept in.
reviews.title: Charming!

reviews.text: A friend and I just spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel in a French Quarter historic building. Located within easy walking distance of all French Quarter attractions and sites, we had a large room (former condo) with sitting area, two beds, bar, large bathroom, louvered French doors and a private courtyard with tables and fountain. Hotel has a larger courtyard, swimming pool, and a smaller secluded pool. All are landscaped with plants and flowers providing a quiet, pleasant place to relax with your coffee, paper, or snack. Small complimentary breakfast was adequate to start the day (save your calories for all the good restaurants in the F.Q.!).
reviews.title: Lovely historic hotel

reviews.text: We visited nola for the french quarter festival this April. Our group occupied 3 rooms, 2 in bldg. 5; 1 on the second floor courtyard area At its normal rate, this hotel is a fine choice for your time in the french quarter. The rates charged ( 2.5x normal) for the french quarter festival, make the choice a stretch. Provincial is a European style hotel.........a mix between a b&b, a small country inn and a hotel. The most charming aspect ( in our opinion) is the courtyard area....an oasis .....which gives you a break "far from the maddening crowd", which on the Saturday of fq festival wknd. was heavenly. Our room ( we paid for the most upgraded) was small, but sufficient. The bed is really comfortable, tv works ok, a/c is operating, bathroom, small. The continental breakfast was barely adequate.(minus any fruit choices) We had coffee every morning and then walked the one or two blocks to either cafe du monde, or a bit farther to daisy dukes for breakfast. There is a swimming pool, but the water was very cold and not useable because of the temperature. The staff were all friendly and helpful. I would have loved to experience the "spirits" which reportedly haunt bldg. 5....but....no such luck. The central french quarter location is perfect.....walking distance to everything!
reviews.title: perfect location for a stay in nola

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are not Bourbon Street people. We try to get away from drunken convention goers, so we spent most of our trip on Frenchmen, in the Bywater, and uptown. Hotel Provincial gave us the best bang for our buck, and I was pleasantly surprised by our experience. It was a quick walk to our favorite cheap meal - Coop's - and close to Croissant d'Or, and Frenchmen.
reviews.title: Great location in the Quarter!

reviews.text: Our room was in building five, which is in the back of the parking lot. I would ask for building 1 or 2 next time - they overlook the courtyard and pool. The room itself was nice; clean, the furniture a little worn, but the bathroom was updated. For a girl with thick hair, I was happy to find strong water pressure (it's the little things). Of course, we didn't spend much time in the room, but when we did, it was quiet. We only heard our neighbors in the hallway - the rooms themselves were quiet, with no noise through the walls.
reviews.title: Added to my NOLA experience!

reviews.text: I'd definitely stay again and recommend to friends!
reviews.title: misleading website

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is very nice and in a quiet location but easy and close access to all of the French Quarter. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early but they were able to accommodate us with one of the 3 rooms we needed so we were able to leave our luggage. The courtyard was a great place to have breakfast, which was included, and then drinks later in the day. The breakfast was your typical continental style breakfast. The rooms were adequate in size and the bathrooms had a place to put your toiletries. I would recommend it to friends and the the value of the hotel for the price was very good.
reviews.title: Clean, cozy,friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Provincial for 5 nights this May. The location cannot be beat. It is in a quiet section of the French Quarter but close to everything. We were on the second floor overlooking the pool. The room has period furniture that gives you a real New Orleans feel. The bathroom is not modern and the rooms are clean but not georgeous. If you need modern updated rooms, this is not the place for you. Bring your own shampoo and soap because theirs is just average at best if that bothers you. The continental breakfast was excellent and they start serving coffee at 6am, a plus for those of us who want to get going early. The courtyard is very nice and it's ok to have a room opening up to it because people are quiet and leave early not to disturb.
reviews.title: New Orleans/May, 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for JazzFest 2013. When we first arrived we were disappointed because our room did not look like the nice picture on the website. BUT...the hotel turned out to be perfect for us. Although the furniture in the room was old, everything worked perfectly. Plenty of space in the bathroom (with plenty of hot water), adequate space in the room, good maid service, very responsive hotel staff. We stayed in bldg 5 in which is at the back of the property. It was quiet and we were so glad we hadn't booked a hotel closer to Bourbon St. This location is excellent; Quiet but within walking distance to Jackson Square and Frenchman St. The free breakfast buffet is just OK, but the bar-tender is a treasure. Kudos to the friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Take a second look

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location, away from the noisy and intoxicated Bourbon Street / Canal Street area but close to the French Markets and Frenchmen Street with its jazz clubs and quieter atmosphere. We stayed on the 2nd floor but not overlooking the courtyard. The room was a good size, clean, with very comfortable beds, air conditioning and a fan, antique furniture, and a complimentary continental breakfast. The staff were very helpful and polite and the hotel was neat, very clean and well maintained with an excellent (on of the best I've had) free high speed Wi-Fi.
reviews.title: Good but some problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a bit expensive for the size and amenities but we were there during the Jazz festival (we did not know this till we got there!) and the rates may be cheaper at other times.
reviews.title: atmospheric, super comfortable, calm but central

reviews.text: This historic hotel is dripping with old New Orleans charm and I would stay here again. Valet parking is on site, which I appreciated, as I didn't have to worry about the location of my car. The original room we were given had a balcony, with a floor to ceiling window for access, which was very cool, however, the room had a horrible moldy odor that the air conditioner just couldn't overcome. After two nights of sleeping with my head under the sheet so I couldn't smell that odor, I spoke with some of the other guests and found that none of them had a complaint. I asked at the front desk for a different room, explaining the problem, and they were very curtious and offered us a choice of two different rooms. We moved within 20 minutes and were extremely happy that we did. Although the second room didn't have the balcony, it had a ceiling fan (wonderful) and a small courtyard with a table and chairs. The staff was friendly and helpful, with a great knowledge of the restaurants and local activities...I loved them. If you go, be sure to compare prices on the bus tours and with a GPS, it's an easy drive to some of the plantations. Admission is about $15, while a bus tour is about $50. Be sure to go to Willie Mae's Scotch House for lunch...the best fried chicken in the world!
reviews.title: This is the way I'd always pictured the French Quarter....

reviews.text: P
reviews.title: Nice and Quiet..

reviews.text: I loved staying at this hotel! Check in was a breeze, Friendly staff, and friendly ghost :-)
reviews.title: Another nice stay at the Provincial

reviews.text: The room was nice and spacious, clean, and quiet, even though we were right in front of the courtyard. Beautiful setting. Great location, just a few blocks from rowdy Bourbon Street. Safe neighborhood. I would definitely stay here again. Only this time i would try and book the supposedly haunted building 5.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, charming--perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 3rd stay at the Provincial and it did not disappoint. We are spoiled by the convenient location, just a few blocks from most places you want to go in the Quarter. In the heat, it is very nice to be able to go back to the room and freshen up without hiking too far. The parking lot in the middle of the property is another convenience. We stayed in the Petite Suite this time and it slept the 5 of us quite comfy. The staff is nice and helpful. They came pretty quickly to bring us more towels when we returned to our room after 11:00 pm.
reviews.title: Nice pool & courtyard & in French Quarter but rooms a bit 'tired'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Provincial Christmas Eve & Christmas nite. The staff could not have been more helpful & friendlier. The rooms are small but this is expected in a French Quarter hotel. We stayed in room 521 which had a terrance sized balcony overlooking Decatur Street which was shared with 3 other rooms. Rarely were the other guests out when we were so it felt more like our own private balcony. The balcony overlooks the park of the French Quarter Market. It was a perfect location for walking to all the sites in the Quarter. We felt very safe when walking in the area. We're already talking about staying there for our next trip to NO.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

likes.disliked: — Be aware if you get the balcony street noise can be a factor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to New Orleans in December because of the low hotel rates (and just because!), and the Hotel Provincial turned out to be a very good value for the money. The location is perfect - only a couple of blocks to Cafe DuMonde and Jackson Square, only a few blocks to the Bourbon Street madness, yet on a quiet street.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was the one over the driveway (the one I read complaints about in other reviews here), but we had no trouble with noise. The room was small - typical of a European hotel room or any room in an old hotel in a city center like this. The bathroom wasn't fancy, but it was fine. The bed was a queen size, which is good for us because we normally sleep in a queen, and king size beds always feel too gigantic!
reviews.title: Decent place to stay, great value

likes.liked: — Price, quiet location (if you are family oriented)
likes.disliked: — Not right in the center of the action (if you are party oriented)

reviews.text: The hotel is reportedly haunted, but we didn't see any ghosts. Darn!
reviews.title: Convenient location! Great staff!

reviews.text: The only complaint was the continental breakfast, which was very limited. Oh, and the transom window over the door let in light from the hall even when all the lights were out in the room.
reviews.title: Definitely Recommend

reviews.text: I ended up switching from one of the more expensive places to this and loved every minute of it. Like in a lot of reviews the bathrooms aren't exactly the greatest but the location at this price is. It's a close walk to all the hot spots even if you've had a few too many! The staff was very helpful and parking was an added plus. I'd def stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice place w/ great location

reviews.text: It is a two-story building with a courtyard garden and two swimming pools, conveniently located just steps where is the action,
reviews.title: Lovely garden Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the French Quarter and within a short walk of many major attractions and fine restaurants. Good service, incl. Bellmen. The front desk never steered us wrong in restaraunt recommendations. On the National Register of Historic Places. The rooms are good, but do not expect modern or recently remodeled. The included continental breakfast was very basic, but adequate.
reviews.title: Very Good Historic Local Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 days at Hotel Provincial. The room (101) was clean. The mattress was terrible. Every time one of us moved it woke the other up. Room 101 was a deluxe room with a king bed that was on a courtyard. Unfortunately, we were also the first room that everyone went by after a night out on Bourbon St. It was noisy at night, especially when people sat in the courtyard talking and laughing loudly and smoking at all hours of the night. You could smell the smoke in the room from outside. Then you heard everyone else traipsing by the room to go to breakfast. Needless to say we didn't get much sleep. Their idea of "luxurious" bedding was a white quilt with 200 thread count sheets (yes I checked the label).
reviews.title: French Quarter Hotel

reviews.text: If you stay here, ask for a room that is in the back so it is quieter. Staff were nice. Good location in the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: We had a great stay, though we weren't in haunted building #5. :( The room was a great size and nicely furnished. Clearly an old building, but clean, comfy rooms and nice furnishings. The courtyards and pools were beautiful, and a welcome wind-down spot after a day's excursions. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.
reviews.title: Great Location, Lot's of Charm

reviews.text: Just came back from my 6th stay at the Hotel Provincial. If any place feels like home this is it. From our wonderfully friendly and helpful front desk person Sherlane (who always greets us like family) to our fablous housekeeper, Esperanza, you cannot ask for anything more. Not to forget the outstanding David who will do anything for you. It honestly feels like you're going home after a long day strolling around the Quarter. It is an absolute joy to sit on our balcony that faces Decatur Street at night and in the morning and just watch the world go by. Because I think the lower end of the Quarter is the absolute best location around.
reviews.title: Will Never Stay Anywhere Else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are so comfortable you don't want to get up, and the air conditioning works perfectly. The room is big and looks just beautiful with its new makeover--which all the other rooms have had too.
reviews.title: Stunning historic hotel
Super cute historic hotel in a great location
reviews.text: The newest edition is the Ice House Bar which we used quite a bit. Our bartender, ATN who is a very personable, makes a dang good margarita and a really good hurricane--even nicer is the brand new bathroom right around the corner from the bar. It's great not to have to leave the hotel when you want that one extra drink at night!

We were also lucky enough to get a tour of some of the rooms led by Margie, the Director Of Marketing. There is so much more to the hotel that I ever imagined, and if people think hotel rooms are small in New Orleans they have never been in room 314! It is huge and the bathroom is big enough to hold a lounge chair plus it even has a private court yard. Just gorgeous.
reviews.title: Average, plain lodgings, fair service, and overpriced for Jazzfest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at the Provincial whenever we've been in NOLA since the mid-eighties. While it's never been snazzy, it's location can't be beat -- well away from Canal Street, three easy blocks to the Cafe du Monde, within walking distance of everything in the Vieux Carre. The rates are reasonable and the hotel has it's own parking lot -- no waiting for a valet. The rooms aren't plush but they're comfortable and quiet. This building has been around since before the Civil War, and some things about that show, but if you don't insist on perfection, it's a fine place to stay.
reviews.title: A little tattered, but still the best location in the Quarter"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel right in the French Quarter with parking which was great. Very convenient location to pretty much all of the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful buildings with lovely courtyard and pool. Our room was spacious, nicely decorated and clean with a Juliet balcony looking out on to the street.
reviews.title: Loved it
" Quaint "
reviews.text: There's a great restaurant around the corner called Irene's where we went one night when there was really heavy rain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel in a great location. I am a full time student who visited during my spring break with limited funds and found the hotel to be very accommodating to my budget, and provided the experiences I wanted to enjoy while visiting New Orleans. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Close enough to Bourbon Street to walk but far enough to avoid too much noise. I had a great time and will be booking a stay there again and without reservation recommend it to anyone who will be visiting the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Quiet in the French Quarter . . but that's all
Pleasant suprise
reviews.text: Booked this hotel due to the fact we couldn't get rooms in the place we normally stay. The hotel is close enough but far enough away from the bars on Bourbon Street. Cafe DuMonde is three blocks away. The service and the rooms were excellent. Needless to say we will not be going back to the other hotel as the Provincial was just much nicer.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Rooms were great, people were great, location great. Can't say enough good things about this place. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Perfect base.
reviews.text: This is a great little-known hotel just a few blocks from Bourbon Street and from the Mississippi. The room was spacious and very comfortable and the staff were always ready to help or give advice. The several little courtyards were possibly just in need of some tidying up but thats the only complaint. Considering its so close to the action, it is very peaceful there at night

reviews.title: Very Good!!
reviews.text: We have stayed at 10-12 different hotels in NO over the years. This one was a good choice. Near Jackson Sq. and Bourbon St., but a couple of blocks away-therefore pretty quiet. The parking is convenient ( a big deal in French 1/4) and free since we booked on the Net (Travelocity ?) Room was roomy, although a bit dated-hey, this is French 1/4!!. Would definitely stay there again. Staff was very good, as was cont. breakfast.

reviews.title: peaceful and relaxing but still in the heart of the quarter
reviews.text: My stay at the Provincial was very pleasant. My room was spacious and comfortable, the surrounding courtyards are tranquil and an oasis away from the busy french quarter, yet you are still in a very central location. The staff are also very friendly and helpful.

The hotel is older which gives it charm. However, the rooms are not as clean as they should be. The carpet was dirty, old and the ceiling fan was covered with dust. The housekeeping staff was very stingy with the towels and shampoo. They also did not dust the room/furniture well. The furniture was cute but they really need to upgrade their beds.
reviews.title: Needs a lot of improvement.

reviews.text: The vents need to be cleaned badly. The air quality in the room was worse than the outdoors.
reviews.title: Good location, good value for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Front Desk was not very efficient. For a New Yorker, they were too slow moving and when booking an excursion, one Front Desk rep said to could not answer any questions nor could he give me any suggestions. Shortly after, I went to ask another female Front Desk and was helpful and actually booked the Steamboat excursion for us. However, it turns out her calculations were wrong. We didn't find out until we were at the Will Call window.
reviews.title: Practically Perfect... almost

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel does not get favorable reviews from us. They really need to work harder on their customer service from their cleanliness to retraining their staff.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay for Mardi Gras!

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night with 3 friends at the tail end of my bachelorette party. The location is good - close enough to walk to the busy areas of the French Quarter, and the building itself is very pretty. We got off to a bad start because we arrived at 1:00 and were told that the room wouldn't be ready until 3, and we were not very impressed with the customer service and the way we were dealt with. The room itself was fine - the bathroom was cramped and the tub wasn't very clean, but it served its purpose. We did enjoy the hotel bar and the courtyard, and the beds were comfortable. Overall, the stay was fine, but no rave review here.
reviews.title: The Perfect French Quarter Experience

reviews.text: Our family of 4 wanted to stay in the French Quarter in a non-chain hotel and this was the perfect choice for us. It has the cutest little courtyard with a swimming pool and a sitting area. There are several buildings that make up the hotel. We paid forty bucks to upgrade to a bigger room in the center of the courtyard. It came with two very comfortable beds, a couch that folds out (that wasn't so comfortable) and a bathroom. It was nice enough, but the courtyard made it for us. We grabbed a drink from the bar at the hotel and sat in the courtyard to just relax after a long day of walking the city. This hotel's location is excellent. One block one direction is Decatur which is where Cafe Du Monde is located, the french market, the parade, etc. It's all right there. One block the other direction is Royal and then Bourbon.Just a few short blocks to Jackson Square, the Riverfront, anything you want. All kinds of restaurants, bars, shopping are just steps from the hotel. We will definately stay here when we return to New Orleans.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with an excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay... this might depend on whether you believe or not, but... after staying here, I believe.
reviews.title: Believe that it is haunted!

reviews.text: The hotel is a very nice 3 or 3.5 star hotel. It is in the Quarter, but a couple of blocks away from Bourbon St. So, it is an easy walk to get to Bourbon St., but good enough to be a little quieter.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Again!

reviews.text: We stayed in Building 5, which is the building that used to be a Civil War hospital. In the night, I woke up 3 times, and I rarely wake up. The first time, I swear there was a dark presence at the floor-to-ceiling windows. It was not malevolent, but I did wake up during the night, feeling that there was something else in the room. So, make of that what you will. :)
reviews.title: Location almost worth the so-so room and very basic breakfast

reviews.text: Being from the 1800s, the ceilings are very high. The rooms are not that big, but do seem bigger for that. The decor was tasteful and nice, much like a hotel should be. It was not the 4 Seasons, but it was nicer than a drury inn and worth the price paid.
reviews.title: Quiet, well appointed hotel in the French Quarter.
Loved it!
reviews.text: We were looking for an atmospheric hotel and a good deal. We found both with Hotel Provincial. A positively gorgeous hotel, helpful staff, and a decent and clean room. The location was perfect, so close to the French Market, mere blocks from the Blacksmith Shop.

reviews.title: Was not worth the price
reviews.text: Incidentally, if anyone staying in room 107 found 2 sd cards in a ziploc bag, I'd love to have them back!

reviews.title: Great Place In The Quarter
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Provincial for 2 nights. The hotel complex includes 5 buildings and is within walking distance to just about anything in the French Quarter, which was great. That said, we were very disappointed in the room. We paid for a premium room, which we were told meant that our window would face the courtyard or pool area. Instead, our room was in the building furthest from the main building, the room and bathroom seemed shabby, rather than just dated, and our only window faced the street. No big deal, but we were charged for a premium room. When we questioned the view, we were told that a premium room also included looking out at the street, so we just accepted rather than argue. Thing is, the room was so small that the space between the window and the bed was about one-half foot. You really couldn't look out the window without standing on the bed. Also, because the streets are so narrow, all we could see was the trees that lined the street. If you wanted to look at the street you had to put your head against the window and look down. Also, when the air conditioner was running, it was very loud and about 30 seconds after it shut off, there was a very, very loud noise - needless to say, I didn't get a good night's sleep. The room was overrated, and If you book a room there, don't bother to pay for a premium room.

reviews.title: Star hotel
reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about the Provincial-- great location, close enough to be in action, but quiet enough to get a good night's sleep. Our room was by the front courtyard, allowing easy access to the front desk-- who were more than helpful with food and sightseeing recommendations! The free coffee, tea, and contential breakfast was a lovely perk, not to mention the coffee is actually the good stuff! It was fun to watch the "Haunted New Orleans" tours stop by the front of the hotel to take pictures-- I did not get any type of "eerie" feeling while we were there. When we return to this wonderful and beautiful city, we will be staying here!

reviews.title: Haunted!
reviews.text: Booked this through Last minute.com . If you do it this way you get free valet parking ( saving you $30 ) as well as really good nightly rates.We originally booked for 1 night and ended up staying 3 days. Beautiful old style hotel with veranda overlooking outdoor pool in courtyard. Pure luxury !

If the staff lead you to the white building at the back of the hotel complex parking lot, get ready to be disappointed: your room will not even vaguely resemble the bright, attractive rooms shown on the website.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is tired and run-down, and so are the rooms. Ours was small and dingy, and right on the street.
reviews.title: Good staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff explained that although some courtyard rooms were free when we arrived, they were being held for arriving guests who had prepaid their entire stay. No one seemed to be particularly concerned that we were disappointed, nor that we checked out three days early. The room rate ($250 during a convention) was way out of line.
reviews.title: Gracious and Helpful Staff to the Rescue

likes.disliked: — Disruptive and inconsiderate people awakening hotel guests.

reviews.text: Stella!, the restaurant next door (but not a part of the hotel) is spectacular, though.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location

reviews.text: From the moment the four of us arrived, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the room over the driveway, the other couple stayed in the court yard area. It was a little noisy two nights out of our eight nights there, but we chaulked it up to selfish rude people. But it is the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Would stay again!

likes.disliked: — No fridge, microwave in our room

reviews.text: I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. I have been there on several occasions, and we always feel like we are in New Orleans from so long ago. But recently I noted they even added wireless internet for free, so we had all the modern ameninities. I can't say enough about this place. Beautiful courtyard. Fantastic staff. Any time I go to New Orleans, I always check availability FIRST at Hotel Provincial. I love it.
reviews.title: I just keep coming back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Provincial exudes old New Orleans charm. We stayed in room 215, which overlooks the courtyard. The room featured antique furnishings and french doors. The ac worked well, the room was very clean, and there was plenty of closet space. The bathroom was dated, but clean and fully functional. The courtyard has a fountain and is a great place to enjoy morning coffee or an afternoon cocktail, although there is no bar on the premises. The nearby pool was enjoyable as well, but the number of deck chairs is limited. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Coffee and a continental breakfast (muffins, croissants, etc.) are in the lobby for guests each morning. The location of this hotel is very convenient to Jackson Square.
reviews.title: Provincial is Old New Orleans

reviews.text: I would not hesitate to stay here again, however, there is a downside to staying here. The hotel is made up of several buildings, and I would not have been as pleased if I had been located in the one across the parking lot from the pool area. Also, persons who are looking for a very modern and up to date hotel with all the big hotel conveniences (concierge, coffee in the room, room safes, room service etc.) would probably not be happy staying here. I knew up front what to expect, and I was completely happy staying here. The more modern hotels lack the charm of the Provincial.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for the $$$$

likes.liked: — It was clean, safe, and inexpensive. Management was nice, and the hotel, pool, and grounds all looked well kept.
likes.disliked: — Free breakfast was not real swell except for the good Community coffee.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were evacuated during our stay due to Hurricane Gustav. I was very impressed with the professional and orderly way this was handled by the city. The Provincial remained open as long as possible to accommodate their guests, while some of the big, modern hotels required their guests to vacate much earlier, and with no notice.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, 18 year old daughter, and I stayed for 3 days at this hotel and enjoyed it. It was clean and well kept, the location was convenient and safe, the air conditioning was great ( a much needed item in New Orleans in the summer), the management hospitable, and the price was right ($62 dollars a night and that was tax included.) Now we used a $50 off deal from New Orleansonline.com, but even without it, the price was reasonable. I'm told that rates are good this time of year. Many travelers don't want to deal with the New Orleans heat and humidity. Downside was the free Continental breakfast (good coffee, but you're better off going down the street for beignets at the Cafe DuMonde.) Also, the maid service could have been a little better if you are the type of person who is a stickler for service. One day they neglected to tidy up our room, provide fresh towels, soap, etc. even though our sign on the door was clearly requesting maid service. We called the front desk and they quickly sent up some fresh towels and washclothes, but even then, they shorted us on washclothes. But maybe the maid was just having a bad day; it DOES happen some time. So this is a very minor complaint. It's a good place. Stay there.
reviews.title: Best Hotel to stay at in New Orleans!

likes.disliked: — Nothing...I always wish I could stay longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. The hotel staff were nice enough and recommended some great restaurants that my new wife and I thoroughly enjoyed. The courtyard is beautiful and the pools are large and deep.
reviews.title: Loves it!

reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I were looking for a hotel with a pool since we would be in New Orleans in the heat. We also wanted a room which offered more than the average 2 double bed size since we would be there almost a week and have different sleeping and waking up patterns ( I hate spending all my time in a hotel room sitting on the beds). We wanted to be in the quarter at a reasonable price. Not too much to ask, right?
reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for

reviews.text: This hotel delivered all we wanted, and was in a lovely, quaint setting to boot. I called the hotel directly to ask a question about the suites listed online and was able to get a petite suite with 2 queen size beds and a small sofa/sitting area. It was very quiet and we had a lovely courtyard, often to ourselves. The pool was close to us and nice, not very busy when we were there. There is a smaller pool through the back courtyard of Restaurant Stella!, be sure to look for it.
reviews.title: Great Experience at the Hotel Provincial

likes.liked: — Great value and location, clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is made up of 5 separate buildings, the 500 building was a civil war hospital and is reputed to be haunted. If you go on a haunted history tour, they may stop at your hotel! Freaked my daughter out even though we had read about the haunting, but also gave her a cool story to tell her friends.
reviews.title: Great value, great location, sweet pools!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem we had was the air conditioner was not super efficient and the room was more damp when it was on. But, we would definitely stay here again on our next trip to New Orleans.
reviews.title: Great value!

likes.liked: — the location, the pools, the friendly staff, the price
likes.disliked: — our room wasn't as quiet as we would have liked

reviews.text: Stayed 5 days and can't wait to go back. Great location for everything in the French Qtr.
reviews.title: These people are nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Provincial several times over the past 35 years. It's always the same, lovely and charming and typical of the historical buildings in the French Quarter. I like this section of the quarter, close to the French Market, the river, the red car tram, and quieter than the areas near Bourbon St. or Canal. We feel welcome here and always enjoy our stay. One reviewer mentioned that the rooms seemed musty, I find this is true in older buildings in a humid environment. The continental breakfast was new to us this stay, and we didn't care for it. Instead we walked the few blocks to Cafe du Monde.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in a great location in the French Quarter

reviews.text: After reading the reviews for Hotel Provincial, I wasn't sure what to expect. Haunted hotel enthusiasts say it's one of the most haunted hotels in New Orleans. We didn't see anything out of the ordinary, but the reputation spooked us a little. The rooms are nicely decorated and it's located close to the main attractions you will want. We walked to the Aquarium, French Market, Bourbon Street, but we chose to drive to the WWII museum. Excellent service from the staff, but the complimentary continental breakfast was not the greatest and the beds were not very comfortable.
reviews.title: Spooky, but no ghost sightings here

reviews.text: Stayed here with friends after a cruise, loved the location, just a short walk from all the action but away from the constant noise of Bourbon Street.
reviews.title: Great little place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are set around a central courtyard and the doors open direct to the seating area or the pool, so if people are having an early breakfast and/or a cigar, you will hear them chatting and smell the cigar smoke, pool area room is quieter.
reviews.title: Will be back
